questions.question: What is the primary problem this website is solving?
questions.answer: Convert visitors to users for DoPlan CLI. Serve as a marketing tool for DoPlan CLI to turn visitors into active users.

questions.question: What is the vision for this website?
questions.answer: 30,000 CLI users. The website should serve as a guide and documentation for DoPlan CLI. Primary goal: Get visitors to install DoPlan CLI and use it.

questions.question: What are the key success metrics for this website?
questions.answer: More than 1000 organic daily visitors. Increasing CLI users.

questions.question: What are the must-have outcomes for this website?
questions.answer: Very well made documentation. Explain how easy is our command workflow. Copy button for terminal command to install DoPlan CLI.

questions.question: What is the unique value proposition of DoPlan CLI?
questions.answer: Personalized, 98% success rate, very easy to use and powerful at the same time. It guides you to make sure your idea will be a real product, and to teach you also. 18 AI agents, every one does a specific job.

questions.question: Who is the primary target audience for DoPlan CLI?
questions.answer: Junior, mid-level developers and freelancers who want important AI tools in their workflow, and beginners who want to learn. They want to have working products using AI. They started to use Cursor or Claude but they can't do successful projects.

questions.question: Who are the secondary audiences for DoPlan CLI?
questions.answer: Students who want to learn and need exercises. Those who learn need to keep trying something new every day.

questions.question: What are the key user personas?
questions.answer: Dany is a 27 years old web designer who didn't have a chance to learn programming but he was involved in many projects and he has a good background and wants to improve himself. Mark is 34 years old, he is a DJ, and he loves computers and he wants to use AI to improve his marketing and social media workflow, wants to make a website for his work.

questions.question: Who are the main competitors to DoPlan CLI?
questions.answer: spec-kit and bmad. spec-kit: Sometimes you don't know what you should do next or even if you did something wrong it will not tell you. Bmad: Professional AND NOT FOR EVERYONE.

questions.question: How does DoPlan CLI differentiate from competitors?
questions.answer: AUTOMATIONS, AND CLEAN WORKFLOW. COMMUNICATING WITH THE USER. NOT JUST HELPING IT ENCOURAGING.

questions.question: What are the user's current alternatives?
questions.answer: Knowledge AND a lot of search and study. It never makes user get lost or go out of the plan.

questions.question: What is the ideal user experience for website visitors?
questions.answer: Because DoPlan is a tool to develop web apps and mobile apps, user should be impressed, because this tool should create similar qualities. Emotions: curious and empowered. 30 seconds: should read and understand our 5 commands workflow. 3 minutes: should install DoPlan system and start to test it.

questions.question: What are the key user flows on the website?
questions.answer: Primary: landing → learn commands → install → first use. Secondary: opening docs to learn more about sub commands to do advanced things with it.

questions.question: What is the design aesthetic for the website?
questions.answer: Follow the Visual Identity & System Design Guide. Modern, futuristic. Inspiration references provided show dark themes with cyan/purple accents, terminal-inspired UI, clean layouts matching cyberpunk minimalism aesthetic.

questions.question: What are the technical requirements for the website?
questions.answer: Performance: Load time targets less than 1 second. Scalability: 1000+ daily visitors. Integration: heatmap, 8n8 chat, automation. Core Web Vitals: To be determined based on best practices (target: LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1).
